German[edit]

Pronunciation[edit]

  • Audio
    		(file)
  • Rhymes: -am

Noun[edit]

Gramm n (genitive Gramms, plural Gramme)

  1. gram (unit of mass)

Luxembourgish[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From French gramme, perhaps partly through German Gramm.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ɡʀam/, [ɡʀɑm]
    Rhymes: -ɑm

Noun[edit]

Gramm m (plural Gramm)

  1. gram
